broker

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • broker.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a single round instance for the game.
    Author:
    GROUP 22 Code implemented by Steven Hamilton.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game(Game toGame)
      This Constructor copies player data, reset the turn count to 0, and creates a new board.
      Game(java.lang.String gotPlayerOne, java.lang.String gotPlayerTwo)
      This constructor sets each player, sets turn count to 0, and creates a new board.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Board getCurrentBoard()
      Returns the current board in play.
      Player getPlayerOne()
      Returns a copied reference to player one.
      Player getPlayerTwo()
      Returns a copied reference to player two.
      int getTurnCount()
      Returns the turn count for the current round.
      Player getTurnPlayer()
      This method determines whose turn it is.
      int incrementPlayerTurn()
      This method increments the turn count by one each time it is called, and returns what the new turn number is.
      void makeMove(int x, int y)
      This method makes the players desired move by assigning the desired square on the board to a player if there is not already another player assigned to it, and determines if the move resulted in a win.
      void resetRound()
      Creates a new empty board, and resets the turn count to 0.
      void resetTurnCount()
      Sets the turn count to 0.
      void setCurrentBoard(Board currentBoard)
      Set the current Board.
      void setPlayerOne(Player playerOne)
      Sets the player one to a Player object.
      void setPlayerTwo(Player playerTwo)
      Sets the player two to a Player object.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(java.lang.String gotPlayerOne,
            java.lang.String gotPlayerTwo)
        This constructor sets each player, sets turn count to 0, and creates a new board.
        Parameters:
        gotPlayerOne - String name of player one.
        gotPlayerTwo - String name of player two.

      • Game

        public Game(Game toGame)
        This Constructor copies player data, reset the turn count to 0, and creates a new board. Use this copy constructor when the user(s) have decided to play a new game. copy the old game into the new game, but switch around player one to player two and player two to player one. migrate all relevant info.
        Parameters:
        toGame - The Game instance to copy.

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayerOne

        public Player getPlayerOne()
        Returns a copied reference to player one.
        Returns:
        A copy reference of playerOne.

      • getPlayerTwo

        public Player getPlayerTwo()
        Returns a copied reference to player two.
        Returns:
        A copy reference of playerTwo.

      • getTurnCount

        public int getTurnCount()
        Returns the turn count for the current round.
        Returns:
        The current turn count.

      • getCurrentBoard

        public Board getCurrentBoard()
        Returns the current board in play.
        Returns:
        reference to the current Board object in play.

      • setPlayerOne

        public void setPlayerOne(Player playerOne)
        Sets the player one to a Player object.
        Parameters:
        playerOne - The desired player object to set as player one.

      • setPlayerTwo

        public void setPlayerTwo(Player playerTwo)
        Sets the player two to a Player object.
        Parameters:
        playerTwo - The desired player object to set as player two.

      • resetTurnCount

        public void resetTurnCount()
        Sets the turn count to 0.

      • setCurrentBoard

        public void setCurrentBoard(Board currentBoard)
        Set the current Board.
        Parameters:
        currentBoard - the desired board object to set.

      • resetRound

        public void resetRound()
        Creates a new empty board, and resets the turn count to 0.

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove(int x,
                     int y)
              throws IllegalMove,
                     WinAndLosses
        This method makes the players desired move by assigning the desired square on the board to a player if there is not already another player assigned to it, and determines if the move resulted in a win.
        Parameters:
        x - Horizontal placement.
        y - Vertical placement.
        Throws:
        IllegalMove - Thrown if Board.gameOver throws IllegalMove.
        WinAndLosses - Thrown if move results in a win.

      • getTurnPlayer

        public Player getTurnPlayer()
        This method determines whose turn it is. 0 or an odd number is player one's turn, and an even number is player two's turn.
        Returns:
        Copy of the player object of the player whose turn it is

      • incrementPlayerTurn

        public int incrementPlayerTurn()
        This method increments the turn count by one each time it is called, and returns what the new turn number is.
        Returns:
        turnCount The current turn number.
